body:
ed25519  would be really good key type to support!
It is more efficient and maybe also more secure  than rsa.
This is probably related to other stuff marked 'Keys', adding it there on the slim chance other existing tickets don't mention this specific one.

issue.title: ed25519 key support
issue.body:
sshdo does not appear to support ed25519 keys - 
## With ed25519 key loaded - 

root@box1:~/sshdo# ./sshdo.py
Servers: test.txt
Command: uname -a
box2.boxen.net
 Could not connect

box3.boxen.net
 Could not connect  
## With RSA key loaded - 

root@box1:~/sshdo# ./sshdo.py
Servers: test.txt
Command: uname -a

box2.boxen.net

Linux box2 3.18.7+ #755 PREEMPT Thu Feb 12 17:14:31 GMT 2015 armv6l GNU/Linux

box3.boxen.net

Linux box3 3.18.7+ #755 PREEMPT Thu Feb 12 17:14:31 GMT 2015 armv6l GNU/Linux

body: FWIW, the `pynacl` package has all the crypto you'd need for this. Happy to review.
https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/67#issuecomment-152269980 (a recently left comment on a not really related much older ticket) is probably symptomatic of this lack of feature support.

Per `man ssh-keygen`:

-o      Causes ssh-keygen to save SSH protocol 2 private keys using the new OpenSSH format rather than the more compatible PEM format.  The new format has increased resistance to brute-force password cracking but is not supported by versions of OpenSSH prior to 6.5.  _Ed25519 keys always use the new private key format._

So to support the Ed25519 keys, paramiko first needs to support the new OpenSSH private key format. See #602.

issue.title: Patches to support sha256 based hmac and kexgex

repository.name: paramiko
repository.description: The leading native Python SSHv2 protocol library.

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body: This is based on forks by EtiennePerot and ashb who did most of the work. Changing the remaining sha1 references in `transport.py` let's me connect to hardened openssh servers again.

body: I've converted all my keys to SSH protocol 2 private key format and it works with mysql-workbench / paramiko. Possibly this is because of gpg-agent caching the keys, but it works.
Do you have a plan support ssh key type ed25519?

@n0ts Still waiting on someone to submit a PR for it, but we do want to support it.

Relatedly, #602 is about some groundwork for this, which in turn kinda wanted bcrypt support in Cryptography - which is now out, so that's one less blocker.

To be clear, we don't have `bcrypt` in `cryptography`, we have
`bcrypt_pbkdf` in `bcrypt` :-)

issue.title: ed25519 type keys not yet supported by Fabric?

repository.name: fabric
repository.description: Simple, Pythonic remote execution and deployment.

issue.body: When RSA keys are used, all works fine. When ed25519 key is used instead, the remote server prompts for a password. Is this because ed25519 key support has not yet been implemented in Fabric?

issue.title: Can't use Ansible ios_ core modules to manage Cisco Catalyst 3750-E with public key provided by ssh agent

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue/PR relates to a bug.

repository.name: ansible
repository.description: Ansible is a radically simple IT automation platform that makes your applications and systems easier to deploy and maintain. Automate everything from code deployment to network configuration to cloud management, in a language that approaches plain English, using SSH, with no agents to install on remote systems. https://docs.ansible.com.

issue.body:
- Bug Report
##### COMPONENT NAME
core

##### ANSIBLE VERSION

"ansible 2.1.0.0"
##### CONFIGURATION

transport = ssh
scp_if_ssh = True
##### OS / ENVIRONMENT

N/A
##### SUMMARY

I need to manage a Cisco Catayst 3750-E using a key provided by a local ssh agent. I can't use ios_command at all under these conditions. I tried to use "transport = ssh" but it looks like ios_\* commands are only using paramiko. I've been able to send a 'show version' to my device thru a ssh command in the raw module so I guess the problem could be fixed by either allowing the use of ssh transport or by fixing something wrong with paramiko using key thru agent to connect to a Catalyst 3750-E.
##### STEPS TO REPRODUCE

<!--- Paste example playbooks or commands between quotes below -->

```

---
- hosts: ios
  gather_facts: no
  connection: local

  tasks:

  - name: RUN 'raw SHOW VERSION'
    raw: ssh admin@[3750E_IP] 'show version'

  - name: RUN 'SHOW VERSION'
    ios_command:
      host: "{{ ansible_host}}"
      commands:
        - show version
```

<!--- You can also paste gist.github.com links for larger files -->
##### EXPECTED RESULTS

I expect the ssh connection to work and the "show version" command to return its content....
##### ACTUAL RESULTS

The command thru the raw module is working (using transport = ssh)

The command using the ios_command is failing:
An error "raise SSHException('No authentication methods available')\nparamiko.ssh_exception.SSHException: No authentication methods available\n"

<!--- Paste verbatim command output between quotes below -->

```
<!--- What actually happened? If possible run with extra verbosity (-vvvv) -->
2351276/" > /dev/null 2>&1 && sleep 0'
An exception occurred during task execution. The full traceback is:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_module_ios_command.py", line 169, in <module>
    main()
  File "/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_module_ios_command.py", line 144, in main
    response = module.execute(commands)
  File "/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_modlib.zip/ansible/module_utils/ios.py", line 146, in execute
  File "/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_modlib.zip/ansible/module_utils/ios.py", line 129, in connect
  File "/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_modlib.zip/ansible/module_utils/ios.py", line 82, in connect
  File "/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_modlib.zip/ansible/module_utils/shell.py", line 107, in open
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paramiko/client.py", line 380, in connect
    look_for_keys, gss_auth, gss_kex, gss_deleg_creds, gss_host)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paramiko/client.py", line 598, in _auth
    raise SSHException('No authentication methods available')
paramiko.ssh_exception.SSHException: No authentication methods available

fatal: [freqm]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "invocation": {"module_name": "ios_command"}, "module_stderr": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_module_ios_command.py\", line 169, in <module>\n    main()\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_module_ios_command.py\", line 144, in main\n    response = module.execute(commands)\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_modlib.zip/ansible/module_utils/ios.py\", line 146, in execute\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_modlib.zip/ansible/module_utils/ios.py\", line 129, in connect\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_modlib.zip/ansible/module_utils/ios.py\", line 82, in connect\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_bEsrK8/ansible_modlib.zip/ansible/module_utils/shell.py\", line 107, in open\n  File \"/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paramiko/client.py\", line 380, in connect\n    look_for_keys, gss_auth, gss_kex, gss_deleg_creds, gss_host)\n  File \"/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paramiko/client.py\", line 598, in _auth\n    raise SSHException('No authentication methods available')\nparamiko.ssh_exception.SSHException: No authentication methods available\n", "module_stdout": "", "msg": "MODULE FAILURE", "parsed": false}
```
